tn.text: Parallelism is common in Hebrew poetry. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_poetry]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
Possible meanings are 1) David wrote the psalm or 2) the psalm is about David or 3) the psalm is in the style of David's psalms.
"acted like a crazy person"
This refers to a specific historical event that the Hebrews knew well. AT: "when he was in Abimelech's house" or "when he was Abimelech's prisoner" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"forcefully sent him away"

tn.ref: his praise will always be in my mouth
tn.text: Here "in my mouth" refers to David speaking about Yahweh. AT: "I will always praise him out loud" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This refers to people who are oppressed. AT: "the oppressed people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])
The verb "praise" is a command to a group. AT: "Everyone should praise Yahweh with me"
Here "lift up" is an idiom that refers to exalting Yahweh. AT: "tell people how great he is" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Here "his name" refers to Yahweh's character. AT: "his character" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "sought Yahweh" means David was asking Yahweh for help. AT: "I prayed to Yahweh" (UDB) or "I asked Yahweh for help" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Here "look to" represents seeking help from him. AT: "Those who look at him for help" or "those who expect help only from him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This idiom refers to their appearance as being joyful. AT: "are joyful" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

Here "their faces" refers to the people who look to Yahweh. It can also be stated in positive form. AT: "they are not ashamed" or "they are proud" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])
David describes himself as an oppressed man. AT: "I was oppressed and" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])
Here "heard" means that Yahweh helped him. AT: "Yahweh heard me" or "Yahweh helped him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
The angel of Yahweh is spoken of as if he were an army that camps around someone in order to protect them. AT: "guards" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: Taste and see that Yahweh is good
tn.text: Yahweh's goodness is spoken of as something that can be tasted and seen. AT: "Try and experience that Yahweh is good" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Yahweh is spoken of as if he were a place where people can hide for protection from their enemies. AT: "trust him to protect them" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: There is no lack for those who fear him
tn.text: This can be stated in positive form. AT: "Those who fear him will always have what they need" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])
This can be stated in positive form. AT: "will always have the good things they need" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])
Here this does not refer to literal sons of the writer, but to the people he is teaching about Yahweh. AT: "my students" (UDB)

tn.ref: What man is there who desires life and loves many days, that he may see good?
tn.text: The implicit answer to this question is "every man." This rhetorical question can be translated as a statement. AT: "Every man desires life and desires to live many days and have a good life" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: keep your tongue from evil ... keep your lips from speaking lies
tn.text: These two phrases refer to the same thing and it is said in different ways to emphasize its importance. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: Then keep your tongue from evil
tn.text: Here "tongue" refers to the whole person. AT: "Therefore, do not speak evil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: keep your lips from speaking lies
tn.text: Here "lips" refers to the person speaking. AT: "do not speak lies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Here "Turn away" is a metaphor for avoiding evil. AT: "Refuse to do evil" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Here "seek" means to be concerned about peace. AT: "Try hard to live in peace with other people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: The eyes of Yahweh are on the righteous
tn.text: Here "the eyes of Yahweh" refer to his careful watching. "The righteous" is a reference to righteous people. AT: "Yahweh carefully watches over the righteous people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]]) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])

tn.ref: his ears are directed toward their cry
tn.text: Here "his ears" refers to Yahweh's desire to respond to them. AT: "he pays attention to their cry" or "he answers their cry" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: to cut off the memory of them from the earth
tn.text: Yahweh will cause people to so completely forget them when they die that it is as if he used a knife to cut off any memory of them. AT: "so that when they are dead, people will forget them completely" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Here "hears" means that Yahweh desires to respond to them. AT: "Yahweh pays attention to them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Here "is close" means "ready to help." AT: "Yahweh is always ready to help" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Deep sadness is spoken of as if the person's heart is broken. AT: "people who are very sad" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])

tn.ref: those who are crushed in spirit
tn.text: People who are deeply discouraged are spoken of as if their spirits are crushed. AT: "people who are deeply discouraged" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This refers to people who are righteous. AT: "the righteous people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])

tn.ref: He keeps all his bones, not one of them will be broken
tn.text: Here "all his bones" is literal, but it also implies that Yahweh takes care of the entire person. AT: "He provides complete protection for him, he will not be harmed in any way" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Evil is described as if it were a man who can kill people. AT: "The evil deeds of wicked people will kill them" deeds" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
This refers to wicked people. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])

tn.ref: Those who hate the righteous will be condemned
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh will condemn those who hate the righteous" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This refers to righteous people. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])

tn.ref: None of those who take refuge in him will be condemned
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. It can also be stated in positive form. AT: "Yahweh will forgive everyone who takes refuge in him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])
Going to Yahweh for protection is spoken of as taking refuge in him. AT: "go to him for protection" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
